name: Oceanfront 1Bedroom Flat in Copacabana
summary: Oceanfront 1 bedroom apartment across the ocean to Copacabana beach, 5 minute walk to Arpoador and to Ipanema surrounded by good options of restaurants and leisure, 10 minutes to Ipanema Gal Osório metro station
description: Oceanfront 1 bedroom apartment across the ocean to Copacabana beach, 5 minute walk to Arpoador and to Ipanema surrounded by good options of restaurants and leisure, 10 minutes to Ipanema Gal Osório metro station
house_rules: CHECK-IN / CHECK-OUT INFORMATION o The flexible check-in and check-out policy applies only when booking calendar allows it (no guests checking in or out the same day). o Check In is 1:00 PM (for the room) but we (homeowners) are happy to welcome guest in the apartment as soon as you arrive in Rio upon calendar availabilities, we are very flexible. o Check Out is Noon. but we (homeowners) are happy to have guest stay in the apartment if departure is later on the day (the room will be cleaned by the maid at noon), if our calendar allows it. o As reservation can occur last minute and change calendar availabilities homeowners cannot guarantee late checkout ( after 12 ) or early check-in (before 1PM) until 24h before the check-out time limit. CLEANING o Once a week professional cleaning is required after any period over 7 days of stay to be paid by guests at the rate of 75 USD per visit, in some huge apartments (4 bedrooms or more), it may be up to 100 USD; SMOKING / PETS / GUESTS o No smok

host.host_location: Rio de Janeiro, State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
host.host_about:
Hi, 
These are Shushma e Nityam - Nityam is my son and together we manage quite a few properties in Rio.

I was named Shushma by my Spiritual teacher, Satyaprem, and this is how I wish to be called. My previous name was Lakini and for sometime you will still see reviews for my old name.
Nityam is my son and his name was also given by our teacher Satyaprem.

We live in Rio de Janeiro and we love this city!

Rio is a wonderful place to be, the nature, the beaches, bars, restaurants, the "carioca's" laid back style, the music, the dance , there is so much charm to it!!

We are advertising a few places here at AirBnB, so people can come and stay  in Rio according to their personal preferences, demands, needs and naturally to their own budgets.

Get in touch with us and our agency, Hot Spot Homes and we will do our best to help you find the right accommodation whether it is for your family, friends or other travel companions.

Airport pick ups, tour guides, house cleaning and babysitting can be arranged upon previous requirement at additional cost.

We are into meditation, healthy lifestyle, Arts and Traveling.
Nityam is a photographer and gymnast.

At work we enjoy making sure you get a nice, comfy and clean place to stay, we love welcoming people to our city and to our country. 
If you book one of our Hot Spots you will receive a list of suggestions of places to visit and tips how to make the most of your trip in Rio. 
We love decoration and providing a homy atmosphere to wherever we go.
Looking forward to be your next hosts in Rio ;)

Thank you!

Warm regards,

Shushma and Nityam



Dear guests, 

Please, make sure you get the correct rates for Special seasons, holidays and special events in town. Sometimes the rates may not be updated in some of the apartments, so please, inquire first.
NOTE: rates vary according to the different seasons.

Bank Holidays, New Year's, Carnival, summer days and Olympics have special rates. 
Please, keep this in mind!

Please, inquire before sending reservation requests. This is very important. Most apartments are being advertised on other sites too, unfortunately we do not have a tool to keep all the dates updated in all of them.

I will be glad to help you find the best suited location for you, your travel companions and family.

Warm regards from Rio de Janeiro,

Shushma

reviews.comments: A estadia no apto de chusma foi ótimo, o lugar é um pouco antigo mas esta tudo em bom estado. o único problema foi que nao funcionaba a agua quente, mas ela esteve preste a resolver o problema imediatamente, mesmo que ao final a gente nao precisou. Sempre disponível para comunicação no (Hidden by Airbnb)

Es apartamento es muy confortable, con todo lo necesario. Tiene una ubicación privilegiada, y es una zona muy segura. Los porteros están las 24 hs y son muy amables. Encontré el apartamento un poco sucio sobretodo en el baño y la cocina pero me explicaron que justo acababan de dejarlo otros invitados. Puede haber sido cuestión de tiempos. La señora gracia que me entregó el apartamento muy hospitalaria y muy flexible a la hora de organizar la salida. Y el único inconveniente si sufrís del calor, el aire no enfría mucho, el ambiente es muy amplio y no llega a la pieza. Fuera de eso pase una estadía hermosa. Muy recomendable

name: Da Grass Shack Lanai
summary: E komo mai (welcome) to Kalapana. 35 years of volcanic activity has come to a end and it’s a great time start exploring newly hardened lava up and down Hwy 137. Four check points that kept public viewing impossible are now open for the world to experience. Newly open Pohoiki beach park, Mackenzie and Kahena beach are black sand beaches you must see and feel to appreciate, pack a cooler and bring your camera for this once in a life time experience.
space: An off grid experience with total dependency on Mother Nature, sun power electricity to light up your nights, Hot showers and free WiFi to keep you connected with loved ones, YES this is the modern yet older way of living in the lava fields . Our shipping container was designed with simplicity and comfort in mind, a beachwood aged cabin for 2-4 elegant and yet conservative. Inside this modular home has a queen bed on one end (sleeps 2) a full size bed on the other (sleeps 1-2) and the outside lanai has 2 reading beds that could be used as well for the adventurers in the family. The upstairs bedroom has more sleeping space if needed with a cool 360 degree panoramic view of our neighborhood, mountains and the beautiful Pacific Ocean. We supply all the basic amenities needed for your lavaland experience including bottled water, a gas bbq, a single burner stove and solar powered refrigerator just to name a few, honestly It’s not the Hilton but it’s easy to find, it’s clean and comfy and it
description: E komo mai (welcome) to Kalapana. 35 years of volcanic activity has come to a end and it’s a great time start exploring newly hardened lava up and down Hwy 137. Four check points that kept public viewing impossible are now open for the world to experience. Newly open Pohoiki beach park, Mackenzie and Kahena beach are black sand beaches you must see and feel to appreciate, pack a cooler and bring your camera for this once in a life time experience. An off grid experience with total dependency on Mother Nature, sun power electricity to light up your nights, Hot showers and free WiFi to keep you connected with loved ones, YES this is the modern yet older way of living in the lava fields . Our shipping container was designed with simplicity and comfort in mind, a beachwood aged cabin for 2-4 elegant and yet conservative. Inside this modular home has a queen bed on one end (sleeps 2) a full size bed on the other (sleeps 1-2) and the outside lanai has 2 reading beds that could be used as wel
neighborhood_overview: Kalapana gardens is an off grid community and locals here are accustomed to this way of life, no traffic, no street lights and best no utility bills to worry about only Mother Nature to rely on, the community here respects and appreciates the aina (land) so it’s our responsibility to keep her safe and clean. We here feel a sense of gratitude that’s worth sharing with the world, a special place in the middle of the sea a place we call Hawai’i
notes: 1) (Very Important) Please no heating elements such as hair blow dryers or curling irons these ruin the battery bank prematurely and can end up leaving you in the dark. 2)The inverter must be on for the WiFi to work, simply push and hold power button for 2 seconds modem will illuminate white and then blue, Lastly input password and off you go, when finished or not in use please turn off inverter so it may have a chance to cool. 3) Sometimes the nights may be very still & quiet please respect our neighbors nearby and keep noise level to a minimum especially after 10pm. 4) Located a few miles up the road is Kaimu community store that sells delicious sandwiches, pastries, snacks, liquor etc. if you need that last minute item (open everyday) 5) Last PLEASE no littering and pick up rubbish that may have blown away if it gets windy, no flicking cigarettes butts on gravel courtyard there’s ash trays for that...Mahalo
transit: Stick to the traditional means of transportation, rent a car and goggle map, you won’t be sorry. Best cell phone reception are thru Verizon or AT&T plans, others may be sporadic to none.
access: A few things to do in our part of town is Guest can cruise north on hwy 137 to visit the new black sand beaches created by the last eruption a few months ago, there you swim in madam pele’s new hot water pond or catch a few waves, guest can also drive to the end of chain of craters road  (take a left as you leave my property to the 2nd yellow gate heading south) for a better view of the last lava flow with no security guards to deal with or for a mild workout we have his & her mountain bikes (ride at own risk) , snorkeling gear & bodyboards on request, If your hungry Pahoa town 11 miles up hwy 130 has great eateries like Kaleo’s for steak, fresh fish and delicious salads, there’s also 2 different pizza restaurants as well as an Italian and Thai cuisine, Pāhoa town also has a great Mexican restaurant called Luquins which is a must. We can’t forget Subway and Burger King too.  On Wednesday nights the best local style gathering takes place in Kalapana just a few miles away from the home c
interaction: We normally keep personal interacting to a minimum, but on occasion we do personal check in’s too, if you need help finding our cabin, connecting  the WiFi, finding the inverter or local knowledge please don’t hesitate to contact us. My wife Dee and I appreciate everyone who traveled this far just to see madam Pele’s work and we thank you and Mahalo for staying with us. Be save, have fun and take of water on your hikes.
house_rules: No sleep overs for free loaders if caught you will be charged accordingly (its happened b4) No shoes allowed inside main cabin, socks or barefoot only (island style living of course) shoes can stay outside on lanai. The windows should be opened to allow Tradewinds in (close when leaving) and if it rains please close (common sense) The sliding glass doors has stick stoppers on them that need to be removed before opening. Do not dispose feminine products in toilet and PLEASE be careful not to scold yourself (LED temperature indicator light will be present)

host.host_about: I’m Kalani, born and raised in Hawaii and proud of my Hawaiian heritage. Growing up here my Aunt had a beach home on the north shore of Oahu and it’s there l learned to be a fish. I’d spend all my free time fishing, diving for lobster and octopus, surfing waves, boating & beach-combing, A typical beach bum and my family worried for my future. I eventually found a job that turned into a career and would you guess .. YES it’s on the ocean and so I’ve been a professional mariner for past 20 years and it’s there where l feel my best being connected with the sea, sky and all of gods beautiful creations.

reviews.comments: If your looking to view the east rift zones recent lava outbreaks near kalapana then this is the place. Located directly on the access trail to the lava this is a beautiful newly constructed container home with everything you would need.

Uncle Kalani's place is stellar. The accommodation is spacious and clean with amazing nightly views of the stars and glowing lava landscape. Most visitors are only allowed to view the lava between between the hours of 5-9PM, but since we were staying at Uncle Kalani's place, we were able to see the lava flow anytime we liked - both at night and at sunrise. Uncle Kalani and Aunty Dee were excellent hosts. They were kind and generous in taking great care to explain how to use and operate the house, and for convenience sake, they posted instructions around the house should anybody forget. It was real treat to stay at this airbnb, and I would definitely stay there again. Mahalo nui loa!

Super convenient to see lava overflow. Best location and very lovely place. The owners are responsive and very helpful. This is the place to stay if you want to watch lava at night or in early morning.
Beautiful place on the lava, great place to stay!

This is an awesome place to stay if you're in search of lava.  The home is beyond the security gate that separates public parking from "resident" access.  Since you are staying at the home, you get to drive beyond the gate and park at the house.  If you plan to rent bikes or catch a shuttle (as far as they're allowed to take you), you can leave your car parked at the house and walk (less than 5 minutes) to the tour companies.  Very convenient.  

The home itself is great.  The shipping container is well designed and very nice.  The queen sized bed and twin sized bunk beds are on opposite ends of the same container, so there is definitely not complete privacy in that sense--but a cute room divider makes the queen bed area feel separate and cozy.  Couch, table, and chairs are all great.  Outside of the container living space, the kitchen area and full bathroom are both located in the covered lanai.  We were pleasantly surprised to find that the shower hot water headed-up almost instantly.  We had no problems with electricity or water.  The upstairs loft is neat, with long, narrow peek-out windows on either side.  We could see nighttime lava glow from the front of the house (upstairs and downstairs).  There is one little house right next door, and a few others nearby, but you really get the sense of privacy and remoteness. 

It you are looking for surface lava flow on the Kalapana side, this is definitely where you want to stay!  Such a spacious, unique, pleasant place!  The location can't be beat.  Kalani was a great host, too, with a fast response time whenever we had questions.

If you want to watch the flowing lava at night... Stay here! It will get u access to the residential road blocked to tourist cars, after the bike rental place. House is comfortable with a nice breeze at night.
Perfect location for people wanting to check-out the newest lava flow areas. It's very comfortable for a couple or family with kids.

What a location and unique space. We loved staying here and it made our trip to the lava a fun and enjoyable experience. The communication was great and super helpful and we had everything we needed. The space is both open (very cool kitchen/living room and upper lookout area) and closed) a secure container house section for the bedroom (lots of windows and doors you can open to get the open feel -- just nice knowing it was warmer on the cold night, secure (to lock stuff up, etc). 

We rented bikes and walked them back to the house (not far) and then went out in the early AM for a hike to the lava (we've been out before and I wouldn't suggest going out in the dark if you haven't -- do a day or sunset hike instead). 

Lots of laterns and such are provided, but it is solar powered so come with some battery backups to charge your cell phones, etc.

Everything was great! Pretty cool house (container design and installations) in a unique location (right on the lava field). Communication was perfect, check in smooth and everything easy to understand (explanation labels). If you wanna see the lava don’t hesitate to book your stay here.
Great place to use as a base or to hang out. We had a wonderful experience and the ambiance and creature comforts were fabulous. Hoping to stay here again. The view of the glow was amazing.
Beautiful place and a great price! HIGHLY recommend.

My first time book the Airbnb myself and lesson learned. I should contact the owner through text than calling. The place is clean and lovely and close to the lava trail. The only issue I had with this house is it doesn’t have outlet or the outlet is not easily accessible because it’s hidden behind the refrigerator and I couldn’t charge laptop to get some work done while traveling.

This is a wonderful mixture of simple living and quality. It is a very open house ...  simple veranda type with kitchen and here to a lookout sitting room at first floor. The actual room is a very stillfully  equipped cointainer covered in wood walls and beautiful simple furniture. Good beds .. a double ( not US size though) and a broad bunk bed.  Both with good mattresses. The shower didn't work, but the bath did. 

It is placed near by the active lava flow and in a relative new flow where people have started to build new houses huts. It is in safe distance though. It is a good place to start a tour to the visible flow. An advice ,, rent a bike to go there ... it is rather far as by now .. January 2017,
Amazing location and beautiful house. Great place to stay after hiking to the active lava flows!
A wonderful spot to stay. Seeing the lava is amazing. My daughter said out of all the things we have done in Hawaii. Seeing the lava has been the best. Thank you!

The Grass Shack Lanai was just what we wanted. We had a few options near the lava fields, but chose this home because of the outdoor space. Our son hoped to put up his hammock, but that wasn’t possible. He was happy to sleep on the bed outside, so all went great.  We found the home to be clean and comfortable, the hosts responsive, friendly, and patient with my own Airbnb newbie failings. The water is very hot, so be careful. It does provide for a wonderful hot bath!  The coffee the host supplied was really good, but if you want real cream (not powdered), bring your own, they do not store perishables in the refrigerator.  A large cooler is available, and a local convenience style store where visitors can purchase ice, sandwiches, beer and wine, fruit, snacks, etc. is not far.  There are also food trucks and bike rentals a short distance from the Grass Shack. 

The Pacific breeze is constant and provides the best cooling system ever! We stayed in January, so overall temperatures were milder than summer.  

Our family was visiting the area for a sunset lava hike (which was awesome!).
We were grateful to have our home away so close to that activity.  The road in front can get busy as it is the only way to the lava viewing sites, but it is also restricted so most people are on bikes or foot.  We did not find the activity intrusive, even while using the kitchen (which is outside).

We loved our stay at Kalani's and Deneen's. 

The space itself was beautiful--most of the common area it's open to the air so you get a nearly 360 view of the surrounding area. The kitchen area, bathroom, and loft were all very well-maintained. The supplies for the kitchen were more than adequate. There were utensils, plates, basics like oil salt and pepper, and a small hot-plate for quick small meals. There was a nice grill that we didn't use (but i wish that we had!). 

There's a lot of common space--it would be fun for a group of 4 friends or family. 

The loft especially provides a very nice view. We could see the glow of lava at night like some others have said in their reviews. 

The location close to the lava viewing area was great as well. We rented bikes to ride out to the beginning of the hike to the active lava flow. We did the hike at night and I would highly recommend it. Make sure you bring extra flashlights and keep an eye on your location so you can find your way back!  

We would definitely come back with a bigger group!
The most beautiful home in the area. SEE THE LAVA UP CLOSE! It is the chance of a lifetime!
Wonderful spot! Ideal if you want to see lava!

This place is a gem. Amazingly designed and built from container. The sleeping space is nice and cozy, the master bed is super comfy and we slept like princesses. The cooking and dining area is sooo big and awesome! We enjoyed the evenings sitting on bar stools and observing people returning from lava viewing point. Then there is bathroom. You can find there beautiful bathtub about which we always dreamed.. Old, classy, with legs <3. And if you go up the stairs, you can enjoy breakfast with perfect view of all surroundings. 
We enjoyed our stay on maximum. You are off the grid, but still in comfort. And btw., the night sky is unbelievable. I never saw so many stars in my life. Even overflying IS station is visible just by eye. 
And Kalani is great host, answering questions superquickly and always being kond. 
Thank you so much for unfergottable experience.
This place is simply awesome!!! Quiet and relax!!! There is everything to make your stay unbelievable!!! Will be back for sure!!!

We truly enjoyed a very peaceful stay on the lava. The house had everything we needed, from LED lamps, hot showers, kitchen amenities to cook warm breakfasts, fridge, binocular. beer opener etc. We could see the lava from the outlook upstairs on our first night! :) The hike to the flowing lava was strenuous about 5.5 hours, but was totally worth it!  We recommend to drive the road 137 between Ahalanui and Kalapana - the most beautiful jungle you will ever see! :)

This place was really cool, loved the rooftop lanai.  Everything was as expected or better.  If there was more to do around here we would have stayed for at least one more day, but it was perfect for going to see the lava and viewing the lunar eclipse.

This was a wonderful 3-night stay in a super location for exploring the Kalapana, Pahoa, Puna, Volcano areas.  The bike rental is less than 5 min walk from the house which is located on the main road right near the entrance to the neighborhood.  Bike for about 3 miles to  the end gate and then hike for about an hour over the lava field (no path) towards the lava glow.  Bring one or all of the lanterns supplied in the home (very convenient) for the night hike back.  Electrical outlet is outside near the  fridge for charging of phones, cameras, and the internet supplied jetpack.  Bathroom water supply was great.  I didn't cook though hot plate and bar-b-que supplied if you wanted to (no microwave).  Slept very well in the double bed and enjoyed both the many, many stars at night and the lovely sunrises in the morning from the lanai.  Only two suggestions for adding to the fabulous stay at this beautiful tiny home:  (i) some directions explaining where the jetpack and bathroom key are stored and how to use the jetpack would be helpful, though after a text to Kalani and quick response all was figured out; and (ii) adding more curtains in the home and bathroom since the location of the home is near the road and other homes.  There are many dips in the dirt road once the paved road ends so I was glad to have the Jeep.  Enjoyed the convenience store near Uncle Roberts for supplies as well as the dining options in Pahoa (about 20 min or so drive from neighborhood).  An hour drive to the volcano park and the Red Road Drive can start at the painted church not far from leaving the neighborhood on 130.  Would highly recommend this home.
This is just an amazing place. Awesome view. Awesome location. Nice decoration. It's a pity that I didn't stay longer. Definitely the best place in Hawaii!

Hands down made our trip to the big
Island. Sad we couldn’t stay longer...Kalani made the effort to come meet us and show us the ropes and give some local tips. Really cool dude that built the place himself...such a cool space. You can see lava from the main bed and most common spaces. Already trying to figure out how to get back...book with confidence.
This place was fabulous. My only problem was I didn't rent this for longer. I will definitely be staying again. Thank you so much. We had a great time.

Even if you have only 1 night to enjoy the wonders of lavaland, the GrassShack Lanai was a perfect choice for this adventure. A newer shipping container home has all the components of being practical, luxurious, eco-friendly, along with added historic Hawaiian touches. The open kitchen with a large deck and porch swing were so enjoyable, and the upstairs observation deck can't be beat!

We were seeking a unique experience, and we certainly got it. We arrived in the dark after a very long day of traveling from Florida then driving from Kona. It was pitch black and a bit difficult to figure out which house was the one as the side lights on the house weren't lit...and we were so tired. We awoke to such an incredible view and could even see the glow of lava from the porch at night. We loved the place and would definitely recommend to everyone.

Great place to stay if you plan to hike/bike into the lava viewing area. House had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. Kalani and Dee were very quick to respond to any questions we may have had and checked in with us throughout our stay to see if we needed anything else. If you're looking for a unique place to stay this is it on the big island.

Upon our arrival, we were welcomed by such a beautiful space we had a hard time leaving for our lava adventure! We easily rented bikes and hiked in to find amazing flowing lava, it was a first for us and quite an experience! Eager to get back the cabin, we found it very easy to cook a full dinner, take a warm shower and rest very well:) the chocolates were very much enjoyed! We woke up to a beautiful sunrise and delicious coffee. All the sweet little touches were very much appreciated. Would love to stay here again in the future!
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Great people to rent from.  They were very friendly.  The rental Is super cool.  They have thought of everything.  Would love to stay here again.  The open air space is awesome.  Gonna miss this place.  Thanks again, guys!
Amazing location & experience for chasing active lava flows (bike in, it saves a lot of time & energy)... Home is wonderful & unique all the way around

This is THE PLACE to stay if you want to bike/hike on your own to check out the lava action. Comfortable, lots of extra touches, comfy beds, the list goes on!  Don't forget to check out the rooftop lanai, there's a bed up there, too!

This place is awesome. The opportunity to stay on a lava flow is a once in a lifetime experience. The layout is unique and we were able to see lava glow in the distance both nights. This does have a little bit of a glamping flair due to the more limited resources but it was well worth it.

Wow!!!! What an amazing and incredible place to stay! If you are looking at this rental don’t waste anymore time and book it right now!! The location has to be number one for the lava hike! You are literally on the trail to it and no public can get in that far until you rent a bike or get in a shuttle. We walked off the steps and got right on a shuttle to the end of the road where we started our adventure to the lava. If your not a hiker and want to see the lava there are amazing views right from the front lanai and upper room!!! At night we could see the river of lava coming down and the glow of the crater!! There were six of us (4 adults and 2 kids) and we all fit comfortably. All amenities were thought of and we felt right at home. It is like indoor outdoor living at its best! Kalani and his wife were so amazing and kept in contact with us prior to our stay. Everything we needed was ready for us upon arrival including local macadamia chocolates and snacks. We only wished we would have stayed longer!! Warmest mahalo Kalani!! Can’t wait to come back!
Jenny & Krystal (Kona)
Sara, Ryan, Jack, & Drew (St. Louis)

Great location and nice open layout.  Close to bike rental and road to get to lava flow.  Could see the orange flow from the kitchen.  Place is off grid but had plenty of lighting and basic necessities for cooking.  Had some wonderful macadamia treats for our arrival.

This was a unique, off-the-grid experience. 
The Grass Shack Lanai has its own power & water systems, and they all worked beautifully. 
The location is really special. We could see the glowing lava from the lanai at night. Definitely not something we get to do everyday. 
We also appreciated the thoughtful extras like chocolate-covered macadamia nuts and the bubbler of bottled water.

Perfect place to stay for your visit to see the lava and area black sand beach. The breeze through out the open Lani is amazing. The views of the flowing lava and stars at night is wonderful! Highly recommend renting the electric bikes to ride to the end of the road for your hike up...it makes going back to the Lani a breeze!
Clean, open, quiet and rustic/aloha charm. We'll be back soon!
This place was absolutely amazing. We wish we could have stayed longer!! It is absolutely beautifully and thoughtful decorated and just incredibly peaceful

Your place is absolutely amazing. We spent the evening sitting on your lanai gazing at the stars and tiny glows of lava.  We took a walk around your backyard and neighborhood.  The lava rock is so fascinating to look at.  We loved your stairway up to the rooftop bedroom.  The view from there was great.  We loved the "open feeling" of your home.  Thank you for all the goodies and box of macadamia nut chocolates. We definitely would love to come back and stay longer.

Great stay.  No issues at all getting past nighttime security to the house.  Could see lava (long ways off) at night and more so in the morning you could see the steam coming off the cooling lava.  Did not make the trek down the road on bike/foot as we had kids not quite ready for that yet.  Would be the perfect jumping off spot to do so.  Accessing the house was very easy with excellent directions provided.

Great place to stay if you want to hike to see the lava flow.  Kalani was super helpful and responsive when I had questions prior to our stay.  The Grass Shack was a fun off-the-grid experience for our family.  We wish we had stayed in the area more than one night.  The snacks and water provided were nice extra touches.

It was great! Just as described. We loved that it was off the grid, and a bit in the middle of nowhere. If you think of it is high end camping, it has everything you need! Liked being able to walk out the door and wander through the old lava fields. Could see the glow of the caldera at night (but remember to get to it is an hour drive). Make sure to go snorkelling at the Kopoho tide pools (30 min away). Kitchen had everything we needed, and we cooked every night (BBQ, small fridge, running water, cooking utensils etc.). Check in was easy, lock box code and use the key. It's more noisy around there than you would think (roosters in the morning, crickets, rain on a metal roof) so you might want to bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. Closest store is a 20-30 minute drive away, so stock up before you arrive. Adventurous travellers will love this place! People who are bothered by a gecko in their bathroom may not appreciate its charm. I have recommended it to a bunch of friends already, and would definitely go back again when we're on the big island.

What a wonderful, off the beaten path place to stay on Hawaii. A friend and I stayed for a few days and would’ve loved to stay longer. Sleeping in open air was amazing & the close accessibility for a biking/hiking tour to the lava flow was unbeatable. Make sure to read the house manual, as it was clear the hosts live by this (I read it but missed one thing. Reaching out to the owners was easy and fast, but their reply led me to believe they prefer not to be bothered.) Overall, a great stay and would love to come back

This location is really special. It's on top of a recent lava flow and the wide open views are amazing. The house has a unique style, really different architecture in that it is extremely open which is charming and special. It's like either sleeping in a tree house fort or on a luxury train. The kitchen is more like a bar. It's really fun.

We loved our stay at the GrassShack. Dee and Kalani were great hosts! We reached a couple of mins before checkin time and Dee kindly showed us around the house and all the amenities. This container home that they have built is amazing with a lot of personal and thoughtful touches. Definitely recommend staying here. The location and view of lava fields is fantastic! (Also highly recommend reading their instructions before getting there).

The GrassShack Lanai is an absolutely wonderful space. Though constructed partially from a shipping container and labeled a "tiny home," it didn't at all feel like either. There was ample space for the three of us and the outdoor kitchen was totally awesome. We successfully cooked both dinner and breakfast, enjoying a warm breeze throughout and utilizing the picnic table to dine. Kalani and Dee left snacks (which we thoroughly enjoyed) and potable water (though we almost went through all of it in our one night stay). As noted in the listing, it's still a hike to the lava flow, but it's nice even just to walk around or rent nearby bikes. We did hear the neighbors at night—they next home is in very close proximity—but that wasn't a dealbreaker and it was otherwise very peaceful and beautiful. We all really loved the mix of indoor/outdoor space and the experience of being on the lava rock. Mahalo for a very lovely and memorable stay!
这是一间建立在黑色熔岩区域的房子,电和水好像都来自自然,房东还备有一个移动wifi,设备挺齐全的｡我和我的朋友2个人住在这栋房子,第二天忘记了退房时间是10点,以为是11点,幸好房东允许了30分钟给我们收拾行李｡这是一个非常不错的住宿,尤其是要徒步熔岩地区｡

If you want a unique experience, stay here! 
Stylish, lots of space, super clean, off the grid, one of a kind house! Off the grid but the bathroom is one of the nicest bathrooms I have ever seen! Great common area, large kitchen and just lots of space to chill and enjoy the naturalness that surrounds you!
Has everything you need, amazing location, clear skies at night and Kalani was an excellent host. Great communication and was very accomodating- would stay here again for sure!

Don’t pass this place up! It is quite unique and was a highlight of our 2 weeks on Big Island.  Our only regret was that we didn’t book it for longer- it was even nicer than we had expected.    Very comfortable, very clean, fantastic outdoor living space as well as roomy indoor space-  had everything we needed. Hosts were wonderful, kind, good communication.  We would definitely stay here again!

This is a great property on the lava fields. The view of the volcanic glow is spectacular and the house is perfectly equipped. It had an off the grid feel but it is not more than a few minute drive to great restaurants  and amenities.

What a great experience we had at Kalani's place. the house is just perfect to see any lava activities and it's located where it is easy access on the main road. Being there makes you feel home away from home because it roomy, clean, and they even have telescopes. On top of all that, Kalani response very fast in case you have any questions.

Belle place pour une experience tres differente ... maison est sur de la lave sechee, tres unique maison vraiment bien amenagee et remplis de jeux (Darts, fer a cheval, etc)  ... par contre, nous sommes arrive de soir et tout etait ouvert et la maison est situe dans un quartier peu peuple ... Toute la nuit, les bruits venaient de partout a cause du vent et le manque d air climatise nous a pas aider a bien dormir ... nous avons passe notre 2e nuit a l hotel pour bien dormir a la place de redormir que 2-3 heures a cet endroit.  Ceci dit, tres belle place a dormir avec des bouchons et si vous etes moins peureux que nous ou avec plein d amis car c est un beau spot a party :)
awesome place. had a great time here!

If you’ve ever stayed in an off-grid home they can be challenging. This one on the other hand is so well-prepared you barely can tell you were staying off-grid. It was comfortable and very stylish and the hosts are extremely accommodating. I highly recommend this to anyone staying near Pahoa.
A really fum place to stay in a remote, but fantastic location. Groceries and restaurants a short drive away, but spend as much time at Kalani's as you can and enjoy the incredible area.
KalaniZ's place is unique, love this place so much ! highly recommended !

The house is unique and off the grid. Had amazing experience staying on the lava fields. Beautiful house and everything is thoughtful. Very comfortable and has all amenities we wanted.  Kalani has two cycles and we went for a small tour around the lava field. Though didn’t have luck viewing lava because of change in lava flow in Hawaii (madam pele wants us to visit again). Will visit again! Highly recommended!
Awesome place and sustainable! The setting is just amazing. Just an FYI -great way to disconnect from the world but you still have good access to Wi-Fi. Highly recommend it.

The shack was sitting around the dry lava. It was unique and special place. The sunrise and sunset were amazing. You could easily see thousand stars with your eyes without telescope at night. 
You will have all you needs plus more in the shack.  Is remote but not far from all the essential in town. Very comfortable place. 
The hosts were very accommodating and very helpful during our stay. Highly recommended.

What is their not to say about Kalani’s place?  The Grass Shack was by far my husbands and I favorite place on the whole island.  The space is big, and there are so many thoughtful touches, you don’t want to leave. Beautiful sunrises and sunsets.  I loved opening up the garage doors to let the breeze in.  Upstairs is a fun spot to soak in the sunsets.  To top it off, As we were leaving a double rainbow sent us off to our next destination.  This is a whole new meaning to living off the grid and we cannot wait to come back.  Mahalo

If you are considering and comparing this Airbnb to others you can just stop now. This is the place to stay. It's right on the edge of amazing and surreal. It's a place to stay and an experience all wrapped up into one. The panoramic views are incredible. 
We were a little apprehensive when we first pulled up, like what did we get ourselves into? (This was our first time using Airbnb, and second stay on our Hawaii trip.) After settling in we begin to see what a special place this is. There is so much attention to detail, every little thing is well thought out in the Grass Shack. And the outside views are the icing on the cake. So much to see! There's even bikes available for a bike ride through the lava flows. We had a fantastic time at Uncle Robert's Market - real Hawaiian culture there, not another show. Check out Suisan's Fish Market in Hilo for fresh poke or to purchase fresh fish to bring back to the shack for grilling.
If we ever come back to Hawaii we'd love to stay here again. Incredible value for the money.

Kalani and Deneen are excellent, responsive hosts who provided such nice touches for the stay (snacks and candies, bikes and beach towels we could borrow, nice soap and shampoo and body wash). The house is down a partially unpaved road (you will have 3 small stretches of unpaved parts to navigate through potholes) but we didn't have any problems with a little Nissan Versa sedan (but also for sure most people around here looked like they have 4WD :) ). It is in a small area with other similar (off grid) houses so while you are definitely not close to a town, you will have other people driving by and such. Not at all a problem for us, but in case you were hoping to be the only ones around, you will hear and see cars going past. The house is really cool. Off grid, but with the conveniences of home like running water in the sinks and shower and toilet, and electricity and wifi. We had no problems getting anything to work (though the shower temp can fluctuate so you will want to be a little careful of that). We cooked a couple of breakfasts via the small propane burner as well as made burgers on the grill. There are plenty of pots, pans, dishes, etc and also some salt/pepper, oil, and other spices that were all really appreciated. It did rain a lot while we were there (it's winter, so we expected it) and it can be louder than you might be used to because of the roof; it didn't bother us. We slept in the container part and didn't use the upstairs loft much except to get a few photos. We went into Pahoa a few times for food (Ning's and Kaleo's) and to get groceries; it's about 15-20 minutes to town. The new black sand beach at Isaac Hale is about 30-45 minutes and it was 1 hour to Volcanoes National Park. We enjoyed our stay!
House is soooo amazing! We have never been in place like this. We had everything what we needed. It was unique experience to live on lava. I wish I could stay longer.

This place was outstanding and was built right on top of the lava fields. It was sparkling clean and had everything we needed (including beach towels, bicycles, extra towels, loads of snacks, dart board). We had a blast there and would not hesitate to recommend it to others. We stayed on the property for 10 days, and Kalani and Dee even came around after 4/5 days to clean the place and leave us even more snacks. Kalani was very responsive to our questions (we had many, as this was our very first off-grid experience and we didn't want to break stuff). There was nothing that we would critique.

The host was prompt in responding when needed. Very welcoming as we arrived late, they went ahead and opened the house for us. Place is bigger than we expected. Everything was clean and there as stated.  They had everything we needed.  Loved it! Amazing place! Highly recommended for off the grid experience.

The place is a lot bigger than we expected. It provides unique off grid living experience and yet home is well equipped  ( hot water, charging stations, wifi etc) . The house sits on top of solidified lava. It has a sleeping area downstairs and in the loft. There are bikes you can use and candies and bars to munch on. We enjoyed magnificent views of the night sky. All in all a wonderful experience.

Lava 체험을 원한다면 이곳은 최고의 숙소가 될거에요. 바로 그 위에 집이 있거든요.
비포장 도로를 조금 지나오면 나오는 숙소는 주변에 빛이 없기에 밤하늘 별 구경하기에 최적이며 건물 통째로 사용하기에 매우 편안해요. 환경친화적인 숙소이기에 
다른 숙소에 비하여 온수가 부족하고,  태양열 및 배터리로 전력이 공급되기에
전자레인지가 없고 헤어드라이기를 사용할 수 없어요.  제가 갔던날은 강풍주의가 떴었기에 추웠고 뜨거운물로 샤워하기가 힘들어 하루만 숙박하고 일정을 변경해야했어요.
추위를 잘타시는분들은 참고하시는게 좋을것같아요.  위치는 힐로에서 가까운 편이지만 볼케이노 국립공원쪽으로 직선도로가 없이 힐로까지 돌아가야하기에   좋은편은 아니에요.
하지만 한번쯤은 가볼만한 숙소가 아닐까 싶습니다 :)

We loved this place! Being on a lava field was a unique experience that I highly recommend. Kalani's house had everything you need, wth thoughtful touches. I was impressed by the space, construction, style, and cleanliness. Definitely one of our favorite Airbnb experiences.

The Grass Shack is simply amazing. The views when you wake up are remarkable. They Grass Shack was well maintained with amenities and was the perfect spot to be away from the noises back home in Illinois. Would recommend this to anyone that comes to this side of the island. If I ever have the chance to come back down, this would be the first place I look up.
Such a wonderful space. Much more then you will ever expect. Awesome side of the island to start your adventures. The house is absolutely great. Stay here on your next trip or regret it.

name: 1 BDRM IN WWP - CLOSE TO OLYMPIC PARK - WENT1610
summary: This beautiful apartment located in Wentworth Point is brand new, simple yet provides everything you need. Wentworth Point is a quiet and peaceful residential area near Olympic Park and Rhodes. Situated on Level 16, you can enjoy stunning view from the apartment. Restaurants and shops just around the block. Very convenient for public transport. Bus stop / ferry / train station just a short stroll. All within easy walking distance.
space: The apartment contains 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom and 1 underground parking spot. The apartment also has a sofa bed in the living room, that can open up to a queen bed and fit 2 more people if necessary. All wifi, linen and towels included. Provide you a hassle free experience. The apartment is only 25 mins from the CBD and 5 mins from Olympic park. The best choice for family or business trip. transit: Traveling around Sydney; by bus, train or ferry you will require an Opal card. You can purchase and top up your card at over 2,100 Opal retailers, including many newsagents, post offices, convenience stores and supermarkets. Download the app 'Opal Travel' where you can plan your trip to and from anywhere in NSW and Opal fare will estimate time & cost.

host.host_about: Welcome to Short Term Apartment Rentals where you will find over 50 fully furnished apartments for your accommodation. Our broad range of furnished serviced apartments provides you with access to hundreds of apartment short term accommodation in the Sydney region such as Sydney Southern Suburbs, Sydney CBD, Lower North Shore, Eastern Suburbs, Inner West, Sydney Northern Beaches and North Western Suburbs.

reviews.comments: the place was perfect and very clean, and value for money. The host is very polite and very helpful. i will recommend it to anyone
nice apartment and nice view.
Nice place

I really tried to see the positives with this whole booking so it wasn't a negative review but I couldn't actually rate you zero - it wouldn't let me. So you have 1*

So I'll start with a thank you. Thank you for nothing.

We feel really let down by you as a company. 

 You cancelled our 1st  booking, apparently there was a problem with your airbnb account. (my alarm bells should have been ringing then, but the apartment seemed perfect for us, location and price wise). 
When I contacted you about the issue we re-booked. 
When requested you price matched the 1st booking. 
When I requested check-in details I had no response, 3 days prior to departure or day before departure. 
After a 27+hr flight from UK to Sydney we arrived at the airport and went to check the address details and directions and found the email to say the apartment booking had been cancelled. I get the reason, if its true, I understand. But we landed at 9pm with nowhere to stay. 
Did you personally offer to help us or find us alternative accommodation with you?  A BIG FAT NO! 
Refund when requested. 
Next day we attempted to book another apartment with you and you actually declined us, when really you should have been helping us  to find somewhere to stay.
That is what shocked me the most, the unhelpfulness. You knew why we wanted to stay, you knew the problems we had had before - none of them our fault and still you refused to help. 

No thanks to you, we now have a different apartment/hotel for the duration of our stay - not with your company. To say we were disappointed is an understatement. 

I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND YOU.

name: Charming  2BD  by Victoria Harbour
summary: My comfortable 2BD apartment comfortably fits two. It is located by the Victoria Harbour, with walking distance to trains, MTRs, ferry and bus stations (including direct bus to the airport). Tons of restaurants and amazing sea-viewing bars are two mins away and yet the apartment is quiet. The mattress is super comfortable and one bedroom has converted to a study, it is good for a long stay as well.
space: Fully furnished and well maintained 2 bedroom apartment. Great location in a convenient, safe and quiet neighborhood. One room has been converted to a study. It is an ideal place for a young professional or a couple to stay. For more than 3 months stay, I can get you access to the six-star club house which has gyms, swimming pools, streaming room, band room, Majiang room and other sport facilities
description: My comfortable 2BD apartment comfortably fits two. It is located by the Victoria Harbour, with walking distance to trains, MTRs, ferry and bus stations (including direct bus to the airport). Tons of restaurants and amazing sea-viewing bars are two mins away and yet the apartment is quiet. The mattress is super comfortable and one bedroom has converted to a study, it is good for a long stay as well. Fully furnished and well maintained 2 bedroom apartment. Great location in a convenient, safe and quiet neighborhood. One room has been converted to a study. It is an ideal place for a young professional or a couple to stay. For more than 3 months stay, I can get you access to the six-star club house which has gyms, swimming pools, streaming room, band room, Majiang room and other sport facilities The whole apartment. On need basis. You can easily reach me via email, phone and in person. Down-to-earth neighborhood with reasonable price to tons of restaurants. You will enjoy a nice run along
neighborhood_overview: Down-to-earth neighborhood with reasonable price to tons of restaurants. You will enjoy a nice run along the Victoria Harbour and a drink at the bars by the Harbour. Easy access to all formats of transportation: Trains( can go directly to mainland china), MTRs, ferry, buses ( direct bus to the airport too) and taxi.
transit: Very convenient. mini bus 6X is downstairs. Various buses to go to different areas of Hong Kong, also a direct bus to the airport A21. Walking distance to train station (which allows you to go to Mainland), Ferry to the north point,  MTR station and taxi
access: The whole apartment.
interaction: On need basis. You can easily reach me via email, phone and in person.
house_rules: Please do take care of the apartment. When you leave, you need to return the building card. Otherwise, it will be 250 HKD penalty.

reviews.comments: I had an ad-hoc trip to Hong Kong and I booked quite late but Jennifer was very accommodating. Her apartment has direct access from the airport via bus. There is also a covered walkway that leads directly to the closest MTR. I found the study room quite useful as I was working remotely when I was in HK. The host responds very quickly to queries.
The host canceled this reservation 34 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The apartment is as described and the amenities are accurately listed. Checkin and check out were seamless. Jennifer was attentive to enquiries and prompt. 

In terms of location, you need to look at this carefully and assess if it suits your needs. If you want direct access by train to mainland China and the New Territories then this is a good location. If however you want access to the tourist destinations on the island and the ferries to Lantau etc etc then the location is somewhat  awkward and in some cases you are forced to use buses - which are slow take some time to get to know. The location is between Hung Hom station and Whampoa MTR station so its just a case of looking at this on a map and seeing if it is going to suit your itinerary. It will take you 25 minutes to walk to TST for example.

name: Venue Hotel Old City
summary: Venue Hotel is set in the Fatih district in Istanbul, 200 metres from Sirkeci Tram Station. This hotel features free WiFi. Each room at this hotel is air conditioned and features a flat-screen TV and a kettle. Free toiletries,towels and a hairdryer in the bathrooms with daily cleaning. You will find a 24-hour front desk at the property.  Grand Bazaar is 1.3 km from Venue, while Topkapi Palace is 1.5 km from the property. Honeymoon package wine,roses are extra cost.
description: Venue Hotel is set in the Fatih district in Istanbul, 200 metres from Sirkeci Tram Station. This hotel features free WiFi. Each room at this hotel is air conditioned and features a flat-screen TV and a kettle. Free toiletries,towels and a hairdryer in the bathrooms with daily cleaning. You will find a 24-hour front desk at the property.  Grand Bazaar is 1.3 km from Venue, while Topkapi Palace is 1.5 km from the property. Honeymoon package wine,roses are extra cost.

reviews.comments: I lovely boutique hotel. The rooms are cosy. House keeping do an excellent job of keeping the place looking clean, I love the way they decorate the bed with folded towels. The location is perfect, near the spice bazaar and new mosque and sirkeci tram station. All the staff were friendly and kind. I would highly recommend a stay here

Super hôtel, hôtes très accueillants et réactifs (nous avions besoin d'1 taxi à l'arrivée, le nécessaire à été fait rapidement via 1 appel téléphonique), ils ont également organisé le transfert retour à notre demande. L'hôtel est très bien placé, juste derrière le bazar égyptien, proche du bosphore et du tram. Nous avons fait tout le quartier du vieux Istanbul à pied. Large choix au buffet du petit déjeuner côté "salé" (froid ou chaud, préparé sur place), mais peu de choix en "sucré". Notre chambre, "deluxe" était vraiment très agréable, grande, lumineuse, 4 ème étage, relativement calme pour le quartier et propre (faite tous les jours). Tout cela a énormément contribué à rendre notre premier séjour à Istanbul parfait. Merci à toute l'équipe de l'hôtel.
perfect place to stay

name: Clean and comfortable room near Jolicoeur
summary: Located 2 blocks away from Canal L'Aqueduc, it's in a quiet neighborhood perfect for nature lovers who would enjoy the breeze of the freshwater canal. For a sunny afternoon picnic and wine, there are parks just steps away.
space: Being 10 mins away from metro Jolicoeur allows for easy access to downtown, old port, Chinatown, Gay village, Place des Arts, and all the festivities, attractions, and shopping centers. So whether you want to have wine and take a stroll in the park, or explore all that your heart desires, the location is great for both. The room itself is spacious, comfortable, and uncluttered. Your door has a password-activated lock for your safety and privacy. High-speed internet is available, of course, along with a desk, office chair, couches, huge windows that span two walls, beautifully lighting up the room.
description: Located 2 blocks away from Canal L'Aqueduc, it's in a quiet neighborhood perfect for nature lovers who would enjoy the breeze of the freshwater canal. As our guest, you will have access to the entire place, (including kitchen, rest rooms, living areas, coin laundry etc.) with exclusion of the rooms of the other guests.
access: As our guest, you will have access to the entire place, (including kitchen, rest rooms, living areas, coin laundry etc.) with exclusion of the rooms of the other guests.

reviews.comments:
Dion is an excellent host, the place is super clean, and I will definitely come back to stay on on my next trip to Montreal 

Thanks again
Karim
Dion's property is very clean, quiet and safe. I recommend it for those who need such a place.  Thanks Dion!
Excellent value, the place is clean and the pictures are accurate, Dion is very friendly and helpful. I decided to extend my stay in his place. Recommended 100%
Belle endroit, chambre spacieuse, lit très confortable, gens sympathiques. Par contre, je m'attendais à rencontrer Dion, mais ça n'est pas arrivée, dommage.
Limpieza, calidad y confortable. Zona tranquila, perfecto para descansar.

Not awful, but you can find MUCH nicer places in Montréal for the same price. I found the place to be super noisy and it smelled like mothballs. Also, someone threw a brick through one of the windows in the middle of the night, so I woke up at 3 am to the sound of breaking glass and people yelling... I'm assuming this doesn't happen every night, but it might not be the safest neighborhood.

Dion ist such a great host - flexible, kind and always happy to help! Thanks for your hospitality and  for making our stay memorable! We will definitely come back. 
Ana & Jacqueline

This place offers everything it says. It is more like a hostel where you rent your private bedroom and many people share the common areas such as kitchen and bathrooms. Subway is about 10 minute walk, but it can be brutal during the winter.
Excellent stay, contacted Dion last minute after finding that my flights were cancelled at the MTL airport, got an answer 5 min later. Thank you so much for your help
This place was a surprise. It was surprisingly spacious, comfortable, and the availability of the parking could not be beat.
I've booked at Dion's space before, and I like it because the rooms are comfortable and the location is convenient for me.  I had another pleasant stay this past weekend.

I spent 9 days in Dion's house. It was great! The rooms are just alike how they appear in the picture. Amenities were fully-supplied. Bathrooms were clean. You might have to walk a bit if travelling by Métro though.

It's more of a guesthouse/hostel. Not a proper home. 

Pros: Very affordable, good value, bedroom and common areas were clean, quiet and bed was very comfy. Also the host is prompt to answer. 

Cons: Bedroom is quite bright during the night (curtains not thick enough to block street lights and door is made of glass). Men's washroom was quite dirty. I used the women's one which was clean. They are individual washrooms so I didn't understand why splitting sex.

name: Direct Ocean View Corner Condo!!!
summary: Gorgeous ocean view straight out from the condo in tower 2 at the Waikiki Banyan just 1 block to world famous Waikiki Beach. Sit on the couch and watch the waves! It is also a corner suite so there are no other units on three sides. Giving both views of the ocean and Waikiki! One bedroom, one bath, a full kitchen and two beds in the bedroom! Pull out sofa.  Free wifi, phone and digital TV with a Large HD TV. Parking available upon request.
space: The entire condo and all the amenities of the property.
description: Gorgeous ocean view straight out from the condo in tower 2 at the Waikiki Banyan just 1 block to world famous Waikiki Beach. Sit on the couch and watch the waves! It is also a corner suite so there are no other units on three sides. Giving both views of the ocean and Waikiki! One bedroom, one bath, a full kitchen and two beds in the bedroom! Pull out sofa.  Free wifi, phone and digital TV with a Large HD TV. Parking available upon request. The entire condo and all the amenities of the property. Guests can access the entire condo. Available anytime by phone, email or text. The beach and all the world famous Waikiki has to offer. Parking available for $10 per day pre arranged or $20 at the door.
neighborhood_overview: The beach and all the world famous Waikiki has to offer.
transit: Parking available for $10 per day pre arranged or $20 at the door.
access: Guests can access the entire condo.
interaction: Available anytime by phone, email or text.

reviews.comments:
This place was awesome! My wife and I had our 2-year old son there. Perfect for staying in Waikiki Beach; 1 block of asking to get to the main strip with all of the restaurants and shops as well as the beach! Quiet at night with very limited amounts of noise.
Amenities at the condo complex were great for our needs: playground, pool and hot tub, as well as laundry, coffee shop, convenience store and snack shack beside the playground.
Parking was easy with no hassles; building was friendly and felt welcoming. Host responded extremely quickly for when we had questions - literally within seconds.
Great location and view . Good for the price as well and a nice place to stay with kids .

Amazing location, great stay.  We wouldn't hesitate to stay in this unit again.  The parking is easy, covered, and convenient (and very reasonably priced for Waikiki), there are tons of dining options nearby, the beach is a block away, and the heart of Waikiki is within minutes walking distance.  Because it is on the east end of Waikiki, it is much easier to get in and out of this building than others we have stayed in on the western end.  The unit had everything we needed for a great stay; plenty of linens, kitchen supplies, beach chairs, and it was nice to be able to close off the doors to the bedroom area so everyone (we were a party of four) didn't have to go to bed at the same time.  Huge balcony with ocean views and air conditioning were a plus!  Lots of nice amenities in the building- pool, hot tub, laundry on every floor, front desk staff to answer questions, coffee shop, little mini mart.  We highly recommend this unit and owner.

Pros; 
-Affordable condo with a corner beach view
-One block away from the beach
-Certain amenities included 
-Nice balcony with some swimming noodles, chairs, etc (we didn't use, but looks useful)
-Lockbox accessible 
-Lots of hangers
-3 beds, (one pullout, two bed)
-A foam topper
-extra linen

Cons;
-Poor communication. Responses were slow and made us question our stay.
-No clear details, had to email and mesage multiple times to get the room number, lockbox code, and directions for parking. 
-We found some magazines for tourist things to do and wifi password in the cabinets two days later, weren't in the open so we didn't know they were actually there. Had to find the router and enter it old school way.
-Small knives only. So you can only do light cooking. Luckily we only needed a small knife for our watermelon.
-One trash can in the kitchen, no extra bags or directions as to dispose.
-Dirty shower with some stains and dents.
-Not alot of room to move by the closet, beds took alot of room.
-Bring your own condiments. No Black pepper, ketchup, etc just salt and sugar.
-Wifi is very slow and may not work at times, not good for those doin work online.
Nice location with a great view.
Great location in Waikiki. Pool and hot tub are nice.

The unit was perfect for my relaxing vacation to Waikiki. The unit was very accurately described. The kitchen had pretty much everything to cook a basic meal. Plus a blender, toaster, and coffee maker, which was nice! 
Only a few short blocks to walk to the beach. 
The amenities at the condo were nice...such as pool and hot tub with a snack concession. Coffee shop and little grocery mart in the lobby were nice to have close by too. 
And the view was very nice. 
All in all, I would stay here again!

The location was extremely convenient and our host was responsive with any questions we had throughout our trip. It was nice to have the option of parking in the building rather than searching for it on the street. It was exactly what we expected based on the photos provided in the listing.

Location was good but a guest book about the area would have been a huge help. Having a kitchen was nice but there was no privacy since the door to the bedroom couldn’t be closed if you needed air conditioning. The place had a typical older beach property smell and bothered our allergies. The beds were comfortable
Great location and view, and list price was enticing, but when cleaning and additional person fees are added in, it’s not that much of a bargain. Could have been better cleaned.
Great location, if one doesn't mind the city noise. Ocean view just as described - simply stunning!
All good and location as described

name: Ohala Place! Newly updated!  Amazing Value! CLEAN!
summary: Exceptionally clean PRIVATE room/bath  with its own entry located within safe and friendly neighborhood. Only five minutes away from Kona International Airport and 15-20 minutes from shopping and prestige white sand beaches. *Please note!* Sean and Rosie's home is approximately 100 miles away from the recent active lava flow. We are in ABSOLUTE NO danger here on the West side of the Big Island.
space: Your room will have its own private and keyless entry, queen sized bed, walk in closet, hangers, two sets of fresh towels, mini refrigerator/freezer, 42" flat screen television with Direct TV access, WiFi connection, water bottles upon check in, small snacks, use of gas grill, microwave with paper goods, basic coffee amenities and on site parking.  Extra towels, pillows, glass dishes and metal silverware are all available to you upon request. Please do not hesitate to ask. Text messages are highly welcomed.  We do have BASIC beach essentials available. Folding chairs, sunscreen, inflatables, coolers and goggles.
